notes.input: Path to the samplesheet for input sequences.
notes.input_folder: Path to folder containing zipped FastQ files. If using this option, remove --input line
notes.FW_primer: Forward primer sequence used for amplification.
notes.RV_primer: Reverse primer sequence used for amplification.
notes.trunq: Truncate each read at the first instance of a quality score less than or equal to --truncq.
notes.trunclenf: DADA2 read truncation value for forward strand, set this to 0 for no truncation.
notes.trunclenr: DADA2 read truncation value for reverse strand, set this to 0 for no truncation.
notes.trunc_qmin: If --trunclenf and --trunclenr are not set, these values will be automatically determined using this median quality score.
notes.multiple_sequencing_runs: If using --input_folder: samples were sequenced in multiple sequencing runs
notes.max_ee: After truncation, reads with higher than max_ee will be discarded. In case of very long reads, you might want to increase this value. We recommend (to start with) a value corresponding to approximately 1 expected error per 100-200 bp.
notes.metadata: Path to metadata file containing sample information.
notes.outdir: Directory where output files will be saved.
notes.seed: Random seed for reproducibility of results.
notes.sample_inference: Method for sample inference, e.g., pooled or per-sample.
notes.min_len_asv: Minimum length of ASVs to keep.
notes.max_len_asv: Maximum length of ASVs to keep.
notes.dada_red_taxonomy: gtdb, pr2, rdp, sbdi-gtdb, silva, coidb, unite-fungi, or unite-alleuk. Other options available. Check online documentation.
notes.dada_ref_tax_custom: Path to custom reference database. Remove line if you are not using one.
notes.skip_dada_taxonomy: If true, DADA2 taxonomy assignment will be skipped.
notes.skip_taxonomy: If true, standard taxonomy assignment will be skipped entirely. Use this if you are BLASTing all ASVs.
notes.skip_phyloseq: If true, phyloseq object creation will be skipped. Only raw ASV tables will be provided. If you are not assigning taxonomy here, this will be skipped anyway.
notes.skip_dada_addspecies: If true, DADA2 will skip the additional species-level assignment step. Useful if species assignment is not needed.
notes.dada_min_boot: Minimum bootstrap confidence threshold for DADA2 taxonomy assignment. Values below this will be considered unclassified.
notes.dada_assign_taxlevels: Comma-separated list of taxonomic levels to assign (e.g., Kingdom, Phylum, Class, Order, Family, Genus, Species, Common). Refers to your custom database.
notes.exclude_taxa: Taxa to exclude from the analysis. Use 'none' to keep all taxa or list specific taxa to remove.
notes.skip_qiime: If true, Qiime steps in the pipeline will be skipped. Useful if you do not want to generate Qiime outputs.
